verses.verse: Moreover take <S%H5375><s%> you up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%>

And say, <S%H559><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> is your mother? <S%H517><s%> A lioness: <S%H3833><s%> she lay <S%H7257><s%> down <S%H7257><s%> among <S%H996><s%> lions, <S%H738><s%> she nourished <S%H7235><s%> her whelps <S%H1482><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> young <S%H3715><s%> lions. <S%H3715><s%>

And she brought <S%H5927><s%> up one <S%H259><s%> of her whelps: <S%H1482><s%> it became <S%H1961><s%> a young <S%H3715><s%> lion, <S%H3715><s%> and it learned <S%H3925><s%> to catch <S%H2963><s%> the prey; <S%H2964><s%> it devoured <S%H398><s%> men. <S%H120><s%>

The nations <S%H1471><s%> also heard <S%H8085><s%> of him; he was taken <S%H8610><s%> in their pit, <S%H7845><s%> and they brought <S%H935><s%> him with chains <S%H2397><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Now when she saw <S%H7200><s%> that she had waited, <S%H3176><s%> and her hope <S%H8615><s%> was lost, <S%H6><s%> then she took <S%H3947><s%> another <S%H259><s%> of her whelps, <S%H1482><s%> and made <S%H7760><s%> him a young <S%H3715><s%> lion. <S%H3715><s%>

And he went <S%H1980><s%> up and down among <S%H8432><s%> the lions, <S%H738><s%> he became <S%H1961><s%> a young <S%H3715><s%> lion, <S%H3715><s%> and learned <S%H3925><s%> to catch <S%H2963><s%> the prey, <S%H2964><s%> and devoured <S%H398><s%> men. <S%H120><s%>

And he knew <S%H3045><s%> their desolate <S%H490><s%> palaces, and he laid waste <S%H2717><s%> their cities; <S%H5892><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> was desolate, <S%H3456><s%> and the fullness <S%H4393><s%> thereof, by the noise <S%H6963><s%> of his roaring. <S%H7581><s%>

Then the nations <S%H1471><s%> set <S%H5414><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him on every <S%H5437><s%> side <S%H5439><s%> from the provinces, <S%H4082><s%> and spread <S%H6566><s%> their net <S%H7568><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> him: he was taken <S%H8610><s%> in their pit. <S%H7845><s%>

And they put <S%H5414><s%> him in ward <S%H5474><s%> in chains, <S%H2397><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> him to the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon: <S%H894><s%> they brought <S%H935><s%> him into holds, <S%H4686><s%> that his voice <S%H6963><s%> should no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> be heard <S%H8085><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Your mother <S%H517><s%> is like a vine <S%H1612><s%> in your blood, <S%H1818><s%> planted <S%H8362><s%> by the waters: <S%H4325><s%> she was fruitful <S%H6509><s%> and full of branches <S%H6058><s%> by reason of many <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%>

And she had <S%H1961><s%> strong <S%H5797><s%> rods <S%H4294><s%> for the scepters <S%H7626><s%> of them that bore <S%H4910><s%> rule, <S%H4910><s%> and her stature <S%H6967><s%> was exalted <S%H1361><s%> among <S%H5921><s%> <S%H996><s%> the thick <S%H5688><s%> branches, <S%H5688><s%> and she appeared <S%H7200><s%> in her height <S%H1363><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of her branches. <S%H1808><s%>

But she was plucked <S%H5428><s%> up in fury, <S%H2534><s%> she was cast <S%H7993><s%> down to the ground, <S%H776><s%> and the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> dried <S%H3001><s%> up her fruit: <S%H6529><s%> her strong <S%H5797><s%> rods <S%H4294><s%> were broken <S%H6561><s%> and withered; <S%H3001><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> consumed <S%H398><s%> them.
And now <S%H6258><s%> she is planted <S%H8362><s%> in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> in a dry <S%H6723><s%> and thirsty <S%H6772><s%> ground. <S%H776><s%>

And fire <S%H784><s%> is gone <S%H3318><s%> out of a rod <S%H4294><s%> of her branches, <S%H905><s%> which has devoured <S%H398><s%> her fruit, <S%H6529><s%> so that she has no <S%H3808><s%> strong <S%H5797><s%> rod <S%H4294><s%> to be a scepter <S%H7626><s%> to rule. <S%H4910><s%> This <S%H1931><s%> is a lamentation, <S%H7015><s%> and shall be for a lamentation. <S%H7015><s%>
